other_tests.findings: Partial dehiscence of the prosthetic patch confirmed by physical examination and echocardiography.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient experienced a new patch dehiscence and signs of severe heart failure two weeks after the initial surgery.

other_tests.findings: Histological examination of removed tissues was compatible with subacute infective endocarditis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No specific pathogens were demonstrated in the histological analysis at various points during follow-up.

other_tests.findings: Enterovirus (Coxsackie B2) grew from a culture of cardiac tissue fragment.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initially no enterovirus detected in other samples; however, it was later confirmed in cardiac tissues several days after surgical intervention.

other_tests.findings: Enteroviral RNA detected from removed material.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Persistent detection of enterovirus RNA was confirmed from the cardiac patches and also found in respiratory and stool samples later.
